ygData.subject: Re: purple and such
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The only way i can tell if hide has worked (which is VERY rarely) is to con any available NPC. If they are indifferent it s normally a good sign that it
ygData.messageBody:
>From: Brandon Kassebaum <kassebaum@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] purple and such
>Date: Tue, 29 Jun 1999 12:08:05 +0000
>
>From: Brandon Kassebaum <kassebaum@...>
>
> >
> >
> > When I mentioned that to a guildmate, the told me that when you go into
> > options & go un-anon, everyone else sees you as blue, though you look
>purple
> > to yourself (similar to the HIDE bug).
>
>FYI, the hide thing is not a bug. You arent supposed to know if you are
>hidden
>or not. i.e. in a roleplay sense, you try and hide but you have no way to
>know
>if you cant be seen by the enemy. get it?
>Penaden
>www.lostorder.com

The only way i can tell if hide has worked (which is VERY rarely) is to con
any available NPC. If they are indifferent it's normally a good sign that it
worked...not foolproof as some may already be indifferent. Best to con
something you know is not normally indifferent as ALL npcs become
indifferent if you successfully hide or are invisible or sneak.

Sartori D'Elsiraad
Bard of Kelethin of the 30th Chorus
Veeshan
